item.title: Abonden house trees overgrown onto public pavement, 10th August
item.description:
The house on the corner of the street is abandoned. Some parts appear vandalised- fence broken. Big trees within the property are overflowing and overgrown into public pavement make difficult to walk past. Need to bend or walk on road. Appreciate if council could cut back overhanging trees and branches. Council has had to clear on other occasions.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harraden Road, Kidbrooke, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Furniture, pushchair, bike suitcases dumped, 10th August
item.description:
Once again domestic rubbish dumped by the mini recycling centre. A child’s bed, push chairs, child’s bike, suitcases. Why isn’t, as a bare minimum, a fly tipping notice installed at the site by the council?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Erith Road, Lessness Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Regular dangerous speeding, 10th August
item.description:
A number of cars are regularly driving up and down Gautrey Road easily in excess of double the speed limit put the public at risk. There are children playing on this road all the time. These dangerous drivers are going to seriously injury somebody.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gautrey Road, Nunhead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lamp post not operational, 10th August
item.description:
The lamp post is completely non-operational. There is no light emitted at all. This has created a significant safety hazard for pedestrians and motorists, as visibility is severely compromised. It is particularly dangerous for residents leaving or returning to their homes in the evenings. The non-operational lamp post is located near the Bus Stop P and just in front of Gutemberg Court. I kindly request that this issue be addressed as soon as possible. Please let me know if you require any further information.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 177, Grange Road, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Escalating Public Health Nuisance – Deliberate Disposal of Bagged Dog Excrement, 10th August
item.description:
This corner was cleared of several bags of dog faeces on Friday, 8th August. However, the same dog walker decided to immediately start dumping again. This matter is now a nuisance as defined in law. A statutory nuisance under Section 79(1)(e) of the Environmental Protection Act 1990 (any accumulation or deposit prejudicial to health or a nuisance). This photo was taken today, 10th August, on the corner of Tredown and Byne Road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 104, Byne Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet
